abstract: Greece introduces sales tax increases on islands popular with tourists, conforming with demands by country's creditors, who have extended emergency loan of $96 billion; officials hope increase, which will soon apply to all Greek islands, is temporary.
lead_paragraph: The increases will affect the islands of Mykonos, Santorini, Rhodes, Naxos, Paros and Skiathos, with the top bracket rising Thursday to 23 percent from 16 percent.

headline.main: Greece: Sales Tax to Rise 30 Percent on Popular Islands as Part of Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Europe; Greece: Sales Tax Is Set to Rise Sharply on Popular Islands as Part of Overhaul

snippet: The increases will affect the islands of Mykonos, Santorini, Rhodes, Naxos, Paros and Skiathos, with the top bracket rising Thursday to 23 percent from 16 percent.
